comments:
Exception thrown by Agent Controller on remote host when launching remote JUnit 
test suite.

Despite the JUnit test suite execution completing successfully, the following 
exception is thrown by the Agent Controller when launching a 'Hello World' 
JUnit test suite on a remote Windows XP machine (Oct. 14/05 TPTP 4.1 build):

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
java:85)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
java:58)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAcces
sorImpl.java:60)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:391)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt
endedImpl.executeCommand(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:122)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt
endedImpl.run(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:262)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:567)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.loader.ScopedChannelClassLoader$Con
sumer$ContextClassLoader.loadClass(ScopedChannelClassLoader.java:334)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:494)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.createFileServerCommand(FileServerCommandFactory.java:386)
        ... 8 more

This appears to be a problem running all types of test suites.  As such, 
updating the component and summary.  

Agent Controller exception when launching a remote manual test suite:

java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.
java:85)

Caused by: java.lang.LinkageError: JVMCL048:redefine of class org/eclipse/hyades
/internal/execution/core/file/dynamic/QueryServerStatusCommand (&name=3AE0910).
old_cb=122BAD30, new_cb=122BA280, (&old_name=3AE0910) old_name=org/eclipse/hyade
s/internal/execution/core/file/dynamic/QueryServer
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:800)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:700)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.loader.ScopedChannelClassLoader$Con
sumer$ContextClassLoader.loadClass(ScopedChannelClassLoader.java:334)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:494)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.execution.core.file.dynamic.FileServerCom
mandFactory.createFileServerCommand(FileServerCommandFactory.java:386)
        ... 8 more

A different exception with the same symptoms when launching a remote JUNit test 
suite:

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.loader.ScopedChannelClassLoader$Con
sumer$ContextClassLoader.loadClass(ScopedChannelClassLoader.java:334)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:494)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:800)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:700)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.execution.core.loader.ScopedChannelClassLoader$Con
sumer$ContextClassLoader.loadClass(ScopedChannelClassLoader.java:334)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:494)
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Class.java:1784)
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethod(Class.java:1382)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt
endedImpl.executeCommand(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:116)
        at org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExt
endedImpl.run(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:262)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:567)
*** Bug 112892 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This signifies that the on-demand classes pulled down to the server from the
client for that particular file system services session are not being acquired
or set-up/linked correctly in the file system services scoped channel class
loader.  It works even with exceptions due to the fact the classes for TPTP 4.1
are in the JARs in the classpath.  If a TPTP 4.1 client was hitting a TPTP 4.2
server and the classes were different for a certain file server command, this
would then become a problem.

Paul, do you know if you are consistently getting these exceptions (also are you
still getting them in recent builds such as the i2 candidate) as reported in
this defect?  I cannot reproduce although I have heard reported cases of it
occurring in addition to yours and Dave's defect reports.  

If you are using IBM JRE plus add "IBM_JAVA_OPTIONS=-DSHOW_DEBUG=TRUE", "export
IBM_JAVA_OPTIONS" in the "RAStart.sh" or in a batch file that executes RAServer
on Windows.  Please capture the output from these additional file transfer debug
options (they will output to RAServer's process console out) and attach the
results to this defect.

If you get this consistently on one of your machines perhaps I can remote debug
into that machine and it will help me figure out what is failing.  Thanks.

Fixed indirectly.

Closing this -- please re-open if found in the test pass.  Not reproducible
using the latest bits.

Verified in TPTP_v4_1_0_200511011123 using both remote JUnit and manual test 
suites (Windows XP ->  Windows XP).
